com.stormpath.sdk.tenant

Interface TenantActions

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Client, Tenant

    public interface TenantActions
    The TenantActions interface represents common tenant actions (behaviors) that can be executed on a Tenant instance or a Client instance acting on behalf of its current tenant.

    This allows for a more convenient way of performing Tenant behavior when interacting with a Client instance directly. For example, instead of: 

     client.getCurrentTenant().getApplications();
    one might choose to write: 
     client.getApplications();
    which is less verbose and probably better self-documenting for most use cases.

    Since:
    1.0.RC

    • Method Detail

      • createApplication

        Application createApplication(Application application)
                       throws ResourceException
        Creates a new Application resource in the current tenant.
        Parameters:
        application - the Application resource to create.
        Returns:
        the created Application
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the application.
        See Also:
        createApplication(com.stormpath.sdk.application.CreateApplicationRequest)

      • createApplication

        Application createApplication(CreateApplicationRequest request)
                       throws ResourceException
        Creates a new Application resource in the current tenant based on the specified CreateApplicationRequest.

        Usage

         client.createApplication(Applications.newCreateRequestFor(application).build());

        If you would like to automatically create a Directory for this application's own needs: 

         client.createApplication(Applications.newCreateRequestFor(application).createDirectory().build());
        The directory's name will be auto-generated to reflect your Application as closely as possible and not conflict with any existing Directories in your tenant.

        Or if you prefer to specify the directory name yourself: 

         client.createApplication(Applications.newCreateRequestFor(application).createDirectoryNamed("My Directory").build());
        But note - if the specified directory name is already in use, a Resource Exception will be thrown to let you know you must choose another Directory name.
        Parameters:
        request - the request reflecting how to create the Application
        Returns:
        the application created.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the application.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications()
        Returns a paginated list of all of the current tenant's Application resources.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all applications, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more applications using the getApplications(ApplicationCriteria) method instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all of the Tenant's Application resources.
        See Also:
        getApplications(com.stormpath.sdk.application.ApplicationCriteria), getApplications(java.util.Map)

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../tenants/tenantId/applications?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getApplications

        ApplicationList getApplications(ApplicationCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria. The Applications utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         client.getApplications(Applications
     .where(Applications.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Applications.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's applications that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • createDirectory

        Directory createDirectory(Directory directory)
        Creates a new Cloud Directory resource in the Tenant.

        Mirrored (LDAP or Active Directory) Directories cannot currently be created via the REST API or SDKs.

        This method creates a natively hosted directory in Stormpath. Please use the Stormpath Admin UI if you need to create an LDAP/AD mirrored directory.

        Parameters:
        directory - the Directory resource to create.
        Returns:
        the directory created.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the directory.
        Since:
        0.9.0

      • createOrganization

        Organization createOrganization(Organization organization)
        This method creates a new Organization resource in Tenant or in Stormpath.

        This method creates a natively hosted organization in Tenant or in Stormpath.

        Parameters:
        organization - the Organization resource to create.
        Returns:
        the organization created.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the organization.
        Since:
        1.0.RC7

      • createOrganization

        Organization createOrganization(CreateOrganizationRequest request)
                         throws ResourceException
        Creates a new Organization resource in the current tenant based on the specified CreateOrganizationRequest.

        Usage

         client.createOrganization(Organizations.newCreateRequestFor(organization).build());

        If you would like to automatically create a Directory for this organization's own needs: 

         client.createOrganization(Organizations.newCreateRequestFor(organization).createDirectory().build());
        The directory's name will be auto-generated to reflect your Organization as closely as possible and not conflict with any existing Directories in your tenant.

        Or if you prefer to specify the directory name yourself: 

         client.createOrganization(Organizations.newCreateRequestFor(organization).createDirectoryNamed("My Directory").build());
        But note - if the specified directory name is already in use, a Resource Exception will be thrown to let you know you must choose another Directory name.
        Parameters:
        request - the request reflecting how to create the Organization
        Returns:
        the organization created.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the organization.
        Since:
        1.0.RC7

      • getOrganizations

        OrganizationList getOrganizations()
        Returns a paginated list of all of the current tenant's Organization instances.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all organizations, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more organizations using the getOrganizations(OrganizationCriteria) method instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all of the Tenant's Organization instances.
        Since:
        1.0.RC7
        See Also:
        getOrganizations(OrganizationCriteria), getOrganizations(java.util.Map)

      • getOrganizations

        OrganizationList getOrganizations(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's organizations that match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../tenants/tenantId/organizations?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's organizations that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC7

      • getOrganizations

        OrganizationList getOrganizations(OrganizationCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's organizations that match the specified query criteria. The Organizations utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         client.getOrganizations(Organizations
  .where(Organizations.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
  .and(Organizations.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
  .orderByName().descending()
  .offsetBy(20)
  .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's organizations that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC7

      • createDirectory

        Directory createDirectory(CreateDirectoryRequest createDirectoryRequest)
                   throws ResourceException
        Creates a new Provider-based Directory resource in the current tenant based on the specified CreateDirectoryRequest.

        Usage

         Directory directory = client.instantiate(Directory.class);
 directory.setName("My Facebook Directory");
 ...
 CreateDirectoryRequest request = Directories.newCreateRequestFor(directory)
      .forProvider(
          Providers.FACEBOOK.builder()
                  .setClientId("624508218317020")
                  .setClientSecret("d0ad961d45fgc0210c0c7d67e8f1w800")
                  .build()
      ).build();
 directory = client.createDirectory(request);
        But note - if the specified directory name is already in use, a ResourceException will be thrown to let you know you must choose another Directory name.
        Parameters:
        createDirectoryRequest - the request reflecting how to create the Directory
        Returns:
        the directory created.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if there was a problem creating the directory.
        Since:
        1.0.beta

      • getDirectories

        DirectoryList getDirectories()
        Returns a paginated list of all of the current tenant's Directory instances.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all directories, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more directories using the getDirectories(DirectoryCriteria) method instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all of the Tenant's Directory instances.
        See Also:
        getDirectories(com.stormpath.sdk.directory.DirectoryCriteria), getDirectories(java.util.Map)

      • getDirectories

        DirectoryList getDirectories(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's directories that match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../tenants/tenantId/directories?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's directories that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getDirectories

        DirectoryList getDirectories(DirectoryCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's directories that match the specified query criteria. The Directories utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         client.getDirectories(Directories
     .where(Directories.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Directories.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderByName().descending()
     .withAccounts(10, 10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's directories that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • verifyAccountEmail

        Account verifyAccountEmail(String token)
        Verifies an account's email address based on a sptoken query parameter embedded in a clickable URL found in an account verification email. For example: 
         https://my.company.com/email/verify?sptoken=ExAmPleEmAilVeRiFiCaTiOnTokEnHeRE
        Based on this URL, the following should be invoked: 
         client.verifyAccountEmail("ExAmPleEmAilVeRiFiCaTiOnTokEnHeRE");

        If the token is valid, the associated account will be validated (changing the account's status from UNVERIFIED to ENABLED) and returned.

        Parameters:
        token - the clickable URL's sptoken query parameter value
        Since:
        0.4

      • getAccounts

        AccountList getAccounts()
        Returns a paginated list of all of the current tenant's Account instances.

        Tip: Instead of iterating over all accounts, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more accounts using the getAccounts(AccountCriteria) method instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all of the Tenant's Account instances.
        Since:
        1.0.RC3
        See Also:
        getAccounts(com.stormpath.sdk.account.AccountCriteria), getAccounts(java.util.Map)

      • getAccounts

        AccountList getAccounts(AccountCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's accounts that match the specified query criteria. The Accounts utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         client.getAccounts(Accounts
     .where(Accounts.givenName().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Accounts.surname().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderBySurname().descending()
     .withGroups(10)
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's accounts that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC3

      • getAccounts

        AccountList getAccounts(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's accounts that match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../tenants/tenantId/accounts?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's accounts that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC3

      • getGroups

        GroupList getGroups(GroupCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of the current tenant's groups that match the specified query criteria. The Groups utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 
         client.getGroups(Groups.where(Groups.name().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
      .and(Groups.description().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
      .orderByName().descending()
      .withAccounts(10)
      .offsetBy(20)
      .limitTo(25);
        Parameters:
        criteria - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of the Tenant's groups that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        1.0.RC3

      • getGroups

        GroupList getGroups(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
